Package view

Class DisplayGUI

java.lang.Object
view.DisplayGUI
public class DisplayGUI
extends java.lang.Object
The class DisplayGUI acts as the view for FreeCell Solitaire. It contains the frame that is displayed in addition to the content and actions that are carried out from that frame.
Version:
2020-12-10
Author:
Devon X. Dalrymple

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void gameEnded()
    Good bye message given to the player before they exit out of the game
    void gameWon()
    Shows a modal dialog asking the player if they wish to play again and congratulates them on their victory

    Shows a dialog letting them know why the move failed, it can be disabled

  • Method Details

    • trashDisplay

      public void trashDisplay()

    • updateTable

      public void updateTable​(java.lang.String[][] cardColumnImages, java.lang.String[] freeCellImages, java.lang.String[] foundationImages)
      Displays the images of the cards to the graphical table and displays a graphical placeholder otherwise. It loads the images to display from the given file paths https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14735085/clicking-a-jlabel-to-open-a-new-frame - Add a mouse click action to labels
      Parameters:
      cardColumnImages - The images of the cards for the card column
      freeCellImages - The images of the cards for the free cells
      foundationImages - The images of the cards for the foundation

    • updateExtraInformation

      public void updateExtraInformation​(double timePlayed, int turnsPlayed, @Nullable @Nullable java.lang.String extraInformation)
      Displays the extra information that a user may want while playing the game. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6118922/convert-seconds-value-to-hours-minutes-seconds/6118983 - String.format that I wanted
      Parameters:
      timePlayed - The time in seconds that the game has been played (starts after dealing out the cards)
      turnsPlayed - The number of turns that have been played
      extraInformation - A nullable field on what to set the extra information text to.

    • moveFailed

      public void moveFailed​(java.lang.String message)
      Shows a dialog letting them know why the move failed, it can be disabled
      Parameters:
      message - The message to present the user if the move failed

    • gameWon

      public void gameWon()
      Shows a modal dialog asking the player if they wish to play again and congratulates them on their victory

    • gameEnded

      public void gameEnded()
      Good bye message given to the player before they exit out of the game
